verses.verse: (1 The Prophet exhorteth the children of God to frame their lives according to his holy word. 123 Also he showeth wherein the true service of God standeth, that is, when we serve him according to his word, and not after our own fantasies. ) Blessed are those that are upright in their way, and walk in the Law of the Lord.
Blessed are they that keep his testimonies, and seek him with their whole heart.
Surely they work (For they are ruled by God’s Spirit and embrace no doctrine but his.) none iniquity, but walk in his ways.
Thou hast commanded to keep thy precepts diligently.
(David acknowledgeth his imperfection, desiring God to reform it, that his life may be conformable to God’s word.) Oh that my ways were directed to keep thy statutes!
Then should I not be confounded, when I have respect unto all thy commandments.

I will praise thee with an upright (For true religion standeth in serving God without hypocrisy.) heart, when I shall learn the (That is, thy precepts, which contain perfect righteousness.) judgments of thy righteousness.
I will keep thy statutes: forsake me not (He refuseth not to be tried by tentations, but he feareth to faint, if God succor not his infirmity in time.) overlong.

BETHWherewith shall a (Because youth is most given to licentiousness, he chiefly warneth them to frame their lives betimes to God’s word.) young man redress his way? in taking heed thereto according to thy word.
With my whole heart have I sought thee: let me not wander from thy commandments.

I have (If God’s word be graven in our hearts, we shall be more able to resist the assaults of Satan: and therefore the Prophet desireth God to instruct him daily more and more therein.) hid thy promise in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
Blessed art thou, O Lord: teach me thy statutes.
With my lips have I declared all the judgments of thy mouth.

I have had as great (The Prophet not boast of his virtues, but setteth forth an example for others to follow God’s word, and leave worldly vanities.) delight in the way of thy testimonies, as in all riches.
I will meditate in thy precepts, and consider thy ways.
I will delight in thy statutes, and I will not forget thy word.

GIMELBe beneficial unto thy servant, that I may (He showeth that we ought not to desire to live but to serve God, and that we cannot serve him aright except he open our eyes and minds.) live and keep thy word.
Open mine eyes, that I may see the wonders of thy Law.
I am a (Seeing man’s life in this world is but a passage, what should become of him, if thy word were not his guide?) stranger upon earth: hide not thy commandments from me.
Mine heart breaketh for the desire to thy judgments always.
Thou (In all ages thou hast plagued all such which maliciously and contemptuously depart from thy truth.) hast destroyed the proud: cursed are they that do err from thy commandments.
Remove from me shame and contempt: for I have kept thy testimonies.

(When the powers of the world gave false sentence against me, thy word was a guide and counselor to teach me what to do, and to comfort me.) Princes also did sit, and speak against me: but thy servant did meditate in thy statutes.
Also thy testimonies are my delight, and my counselors.
DALETHMy soul cleaveth to the (That is, it is almost brought to the grave, and without thy word I cannot live.) dust: quicken me according to thy word.
I have (I have confessed mine offences, and now depend wholly on thee.) declared my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy statutes.
Make me to understand the way of thy precepts, and I will meditate in thy wondrous works.
My soul melteth for heaviness: raise me up according to thy (If God did not maintain us by his word, our life would drop away like water.) word.
Take from me the (Instruct me in thy word, whereby my mind may be purged from vanity, and taught to obey thy will.) way of lying, and grant me graciously thy Law.
I have chosen the way of truth, and thy judgments have I laid before me.
I have cleaved to thy testimonies, O Lord: confound me not.

I will run the way of thy commandments, when thou (By this he showeth that we can neither choose good, cleave to God’s word, nor turn forward in his way, except he make our hearts large to receive grace, and willing to obey.) shalt enlarge mine heart.
HETeach (He showeth that he cannot follow on to the end, except God teach him ofttimes, and lead him forward.) me, O Lord, the way of thy statutes, and I will keep it unto the end.
Give me understanding and I will keep thy Law, yea, I will keep it with my whole (Not only in outward conversation, but also with inward affection.) heart.
Direct me in the path of thy commandments: for therein is my delight.
Incline mine heart unto thy testimonies: and not to (Hereby meaning all other vices, because that covetousness is the root of all evil.) covetousness.
Turn away mine (Meaning, all his senses.) eyes from regarding vanity, and quicken me in thy way.
Stablish thy promise to thy servant, because he feareth thee.
Take away (Let me not fall to thy dishonor, but let mine heart still delight in thy gracious word.) my rebuke that I fear: for thy judgments are good.
Behold, I desire thy commandments: (Give me strength to continue in thy word even to the end.) quicken me in thy righteousness.
VAUAnd let thy loving (He showeth that God’s mercy and love is the first cause of our salvation.) kindness come unto me, O Lord, and thy salvation according to thy promise.
So shall I (By trusting in God’s word he assureth himself to be able to confute the slanders of his adversaries.) make answer unto my blasphemers: for I trust in thy word.
And take not the word of truth utterly out of my mouth: for I wait for thy judgments.
So shall I always keep thy Law forever and ever.
And I will (They that simply walk after God’s word, have no lets to entangle them, whereas they that do contrary, are ever in nets and snares.) walk at liberty: for I seek thy precepts.
I will speak also of thy testimonies before (He showeth that the children of God ought not to suffer their father’s glory to be obscured by the vain pomp of princes.) Kings, and will not be ashamed.
And my delight shall be in thy Commandments, which I have loved.
Mine hands also will I lift up unto thy Commandments, which I have loved, and I will meditate in thy statutes.
ZAINRemember (Though he feel God’s hand still to lie upon him, yet he resteth on his promise, and comforteth himself therein.) the promise made to thy servant, wherein thou hast caused me to trust.
It is my comfort in my trouble; for thy promise hath quickened me.
The (Meaning, the wicked, which contemn God’s word, and tread his Religion under foot.) proud have had me exceedingly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy Law.
I remembered thy (That is, the examples, whereby thou declarest thyself to be judge of the world.) judgments of old, O Lord, and have been comforted.
(That is, a vehement zeal to thy glory and indignation against the wicked.) Fear is come upon me for the wicked, that forsake thy Law.
Thy statutes have been my songs in the house of my (In the course of this life and sorrowful exit.) pilgrimage.
I have remembered thy Name, O Lord, in the (Even when others sleep.) night, and have kept thy Law.
(That is, all these benefits.) This I had because I kept thy precepts.
CHETHO Lord, that art my (I am persuaded that to keep thy Law is an heritage and great gain for me.) portion, I have determined to keep thy words.
I made my supplication in thy presence with my whole heart: be merciful unto me according to thy promise.
I have considered my (He showeth that none can embrace the word of God, except he consider his own imperfections and ways.) ways, and turned my feet into thy testimonies.
I made haste and delayed not to keep thy commandments.
The bands of the wicked have (They have gone about to draw me into their company.) robbed me: but I have not forgotten thy Law.
At midnight will I rise to give thanks unto thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
I am (Not only in mutual consent, but also with aid and succor.) companion of all them that fear thee, and keep thy precepts.
The earth, O Lord, is full of thy mercy: (For the knowledge of God’s word is a singular token of his favor.) teach me thy statutes.

TETHO Lord, thou hast dealt (Having proved by experience that God was true in his promise, he desireth that he would increase in him knowledge and judgment.) graciously with thy servant, according unto thy word.
Teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believed thy commandments.

Before I was (So Jeremiah saith, that before the Lord touched him, he was like a calf untamed: so that the use of God’s rod is to call us home to God.) afflicted, I went astray: but now I keep thy word.
Thou art good and gracious: teach me thy statutes.
The proud have imagined a lie against me: but I will keep thy precepts with my whole heart.
(Their heart is indurated and hardened, puffed up with prosperity and vain estimation of themselves.) Their heart is fat as grease, but my delight is in thy Law.
It is (He confesseth that before that he was chastened, he was rebellious, as man by nature is.) good for me that I have been afflicted, that I may learn thy statutes.
The Law of thy mouth is better unto me, than thousands of gold and silver.

JODThine hands have (Because God leaveth not his work that he hath begun, he desireth a new grace: that is, that he would continue his mercies.) made me and fashioned me: give me understanding therefore, that I may learn thy commandments.
So they that (When God showeth his grace toward any, he testifieth to others, that he faileth not them that trust in him.) fear thee, seeing me, shall rejoice, because I have trusted in thy word.
I know, O Lord, that thy judgments are right, and that thou hast afflicted me (Hebrew, in truth.) justly.
I pray thee that thy mercy may comfort me, according to thy promise unto thy servant.
Let thy tender mercies come unto me, that I may (He declareth, that when he felt not God’s mercies, he was as dead.) live: for thy Law is my delight.
Let the proud be ashamed: for they have dealt wickedly and falsely with me: but I meditate in thy precepts.
Let such as fear thee (That is, be comforted by mine example.) turn unto me, and they that (He showeth that there can be no true fear of God without the knowledge of his word.) know thy testimonies.
Let mine heart be upright in thy statutes, that I be not ashamed.
CAPHMy soul (Though my strength fail me, yet my soul groaneth and sigheth, resting still in thy word.) fainted for thy salvation: yet I wait for thy word.
Mine eyes fail for thy promise, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
For I am like a (Like a skin bottle or bladder that is parched in the smoke.) bottle in the smoke; yet do I not forget thy statutes.
How many are the (How long wilt thou afflict thy servant.) days of thy servant? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?
The proud have (They have not only oppressed me violently, but also craftily conspired against me.) dug pits for me, which is not after thy Law.
All thy commandments are true: they persecute me falsely: (He assureth himself, that God will deliver his, and destroy such as unjustly persecute them.) help me.
They had almost consumed (Finding no help in earth, he lifteth up his eyes to heaven.) me upon the earth: but I forsook not thy precepts.
Quicken me according to thy loving kindness: so shall I keep the testimony of thy mouth.

LAMEDO Lord, thy word endureth forever in (Because none should esteem God’s word according to the changes of things in this world, he showeth that it abideth in heaven, and therefore is immutable.) heaven.
Thy truth is from generation to generation: thou hast laid the foundation of the earth, and it abideth.

They (Seeing the earth and all creatures remain in that estate wherein thou hast created them, much more thy truth remaineth constant and unchangeable.) continue even to this day by thine ordinances: for all are thy servants.
Except thy law had been my delight, I should now have perished in mine affliction.
I will never forget thy precepts: for by them thou hast quickened me.
I am (He proveth by effect that he is God’s child, because he seeketh to understand his word.) thine, save me: for I have sought thy precepts.
The wicked have waited for me to destroy me: but I will consider thy testimonies.
I (There is nothing so perfect in earth, but it hath an end, only God’s word lasteth forever.) have seen an end of all perfection: but thy commandment is exceeding large.
MEMOh how love I thy law! it is my meditation (He showeth that we cannot love God’s word, except we exercise ourselves therein and practice it.) continually.
By thy commandments thou hast made me wiser than mine enemies: for they are ever with me.

I have had more (Whosoever doth submit himself only to God’s word, shall not only be safe against the practices of his enemies, but also learn more wisdom than they that profess it, and are men of experience.) understanding than all my teachers: for thy testimonies are my meditation.
I understood more than the ancient, because I kept thy precepts.
I have refrained my feet from every evil way, that I might keep thy word.

I have not declined from thy judgments: for (So then of ourselves we can do nothing: but when God doth inwardly instruct us with his spirit, we feel his graces sweeter than honey.) thou didst teach me.
How sweet are thy promises unto my mouth! yea, more than honey unto my mouth.
By thy precepts I have gotten understanding: therefore I hate all the ways of falsehood.
NUNThy word is a (Of ourselves we are but darkness and cannot see except we be lightened with God’s Word.) lantern unto my feet, and a light unto my paths.

I have (So all the faithful ought to bind themselves to God by a solemn oath and promises, to stir up their zeal to embrace God’s word.) sworn and will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
I am very sore afflicted: O Lord, quicken me according to thy word.
O Lord, I beseech thee, accept the (That is, my prayers and thanksgiving which sacrifice Hosea calleth the calves of the lips, Hos. 14:3.) free offering of my mouth, and teach me thy judgments.
My (That is, I am in continual danger of my life.) soul is continually in mine hand: yet do I not forget thy law.
The wicked have laid a snare for me: but I swerved not from thy precepts.
Thy testimonies have I taken as an (I esteemed no worldly things, but made thy word mine inheritance.) heritage forever: for they are the joy of mine heart.
I have applied mine heart to fulfill thy statutes always, even unto the end.
SAMECHI hate (Whosoever will embrace God’s word aright, must abhor all fantasies and imaginations both of himself and others.) vain inventions: but thy Law do I love.
Thou art my refuge and shield, and I trust in thy word.
(And hinder me not to keep the Law of the Lord.) Away from me, ye wicked: for I will keep the commandments of my God.
Stablish me according to thy promise, that I may live, and disappoint me not of mine hope.
(He desireth God’s continual assistance, lest he should faint in this race, which he had begun.) Stay thou me, and I shall be safe, and I will delight continually in thy statutes.
Thou hast trodden down all them that depart from thy statutes: for their (The crafty practices of them that contemn thy Law, shall be brought to naught.) deceit is vain.
Thou hast taken away all the wicked of the earth like (Which infected thy people, as dross doth the metal.) dross: therefore I love thy testimonies.

My flesh (Thy judgments do not only teach me obedience, but cause me to fear, considering mine own weakness, which fear causeth repentance.) trembleth for fear of thee, and I am afraid of thy judgments.
AINI have executed judgment and justice: leave me not to mine oppressor.
(Put thyself between mine enemies and me, as if thou were my pledge.) Answer for thy servant in that which is good, and let not the proud oppress me.
Mine eyes have failed in waiting for thy salvation, and for thy just promise.

Deal with thy (He boasteth not that he is God’s servant, but hereby putteth God in mind that as he made him his by his grace, so he would continue his favor toward him.) servant according to thy mercy, and teach me thy statutes.
I am thy servant: grant me therefore understanding, that I may know thy testimonies.

It is (The Prophet showeth that when the wicked have brought all things to confusion, and God’s word to utter contempt, then it is God’s time to help and send remedy.) time for thee, Lord, to work: for they have destroyed thy Law.
Therefore love I thy commandments above gold, yea, above most fine gold.
Therefore I esteem all thy precepts most just, and hate all false (That is, whatsoever dissenteth from the purity of thy word.) ways.
PEThy testimonies are (Containing high and secret mysteries, so that I am moved with admiration and reverence.) wonderful: therefore doth my soul keep them.

The entrance into thy (The simple idiots that submit themselves to God, have their eyes opened and their minds illuminated, so soon as they begin to read God’s word.) words showeth light, and giveth understanding to the simple.
I opened my mouth, and (My zeal toward thy word was so great.) panted, because I loved thy commandments.
Look upon me and be merciful unto me, as thou usest to do unto those that love thy Name.
Direct my steps in thy word, and let none iniquity have dominion over me.
Deliver me from the oppression of men, and I will keep thy precepts.
Show the light of thy countenance upon thy servant, and teach me thy statute.
Mine eyes gush (He showeth what ought to be the zeal of God’s children, when they see his word contemned.) out with rivers of water, because they keep not thy Law.
TZADDIRighteous art thou, O Lord, and just are thy judgments.
Thou hast commanded (We cannot confess God to be righteous, except we live uprightly and truly, as he hath commanded.) justice by thy testimonies and truth especially.
(Cross references: : Ps. 69:9; John 2:17) My zeal hath even consumed me: because mine enemies have forgotten thy words.
Thy word is proved (Gold hath need to be fined, but thy word is perfection itself.) most pure, and thy servant loveth it.
I am (This is the true trial, to praise God in adversity.) small and despised: yet do I not forget thy precepts.
Thy righteousness is an everlasting righteousness, and thy Law is truth.
Trouble and anguish are come upon me: yet are the commandments my delight.
The righteousness of thy testimonies is everlasting: grant me understanding, and I shall (So that the life of man without the knowledge of God, is death.) live.
KOPHI have (He showeth that all his affections and whole heart were bent to Godward for to have help in his dangers.) cried with my whole heart: hear me, O Lord, and I will keep thy statutes.
I called upon thee: save me, and I will keep thy testimonies.
I prevented the morning light, and cried: for I waited on thy word.
Mine eyes (He was more earnest in the study of God’s word, than they that kept the watch were in their charge.) prevent the night watches, to meditate in thy word.
Hear my voice according to thy loving kindness: O Lord, quicken me according to thy (Or, custom.) judgment.
They draw near that follow after (He showeth the nature of the wicked to be to persecute against their conscience.) malice, and are far from thy Law.
Thou art near, O Lord: for all thy commandments are true.
I have known long since (His faith is grounded upon God’s word, that he would ever be at hand when his children be oppressed.) by thy testimonies, that thou hast established them forever.
RESHBehold mine affliction, and deliver me: for I have not forgotten thy law.
Plead my cause, and deliver me: quicken me according unto thy (For without God’s promise there is no hope of deliverance.) word.
Salvation is far from the wicked, because they seek not thy statutes.
Great art thy tender mercies, O Lord: quicken me according to thy (According to thy promise made in the law, which because the wicked lack, they can have no hope of salvation.) judgments.
My persecutors and mine oppressors are many: yet do I not swerve from thy testimonies.
I saw the transgressors and was (My zeal consumed me when I saw their malice and contempt of thy glory.) grieved, because they kept not thy word.
Consider, O Lord, how I (It is a sure sign of our adoption, when we love the Law of God.) love thy precepts: quicken me according to thy loving kindness.
The (Since thou first promised it, even to the end all thy sayings are true.) beginning of thy word is truth, and all the judgments of thy righteousness endure forever.

SCHINPrinces have (The threatenings and persecutions of princes could not cause me to shrink to confess thee whom I more fear than men.) persecuted me without cause: but mine heart stood in awe of thy words.
I rejoice at thy word, as one that findeth a great spoil.
I hate falsehood and abhor it, but thy Law do I love.
(That is, often and sundry times.) Seven times a day do I praise thee, because of thy righteous judgments.
They that (For their conscience assureth them that they please thee, whereas they that love not thee, have the contrary.) love thy law, shall have great prosperity, and they shall have none hurt.
Lord, I have (He showeth that we must first have faith before we can work and please God.) trusted in thy salvation, and have done thy commandments.
My soul hath kept thy testimonies: for I love them exceedingly.
I have kept thy precepts and thy testimonies: (I had no respect of men, but set thee always before mine eyes, as the judge of my doings.) for all my ways are before thee.
TAULet my complaint come before thee, O Lord, and give me understanding (As thou hast promised to be the schoolmaster unto all them that depend upon thee.) according unto thy word.
Let my supplication come before thee, and deliver me according to thy promise.
My lips shall (The word signifieth to pour forth continually.) speak praise, when thou hast (All his prayer and desire is to profit in the word of God.) taught me thy statutes.
My tongue shall entreat of thy word: for all thy commandments are righteous.
Let thine hand help me: for I have chosen thy precepts.
I have longed for thy salvation, O Lord, and thy Law is my delight.
Let my soul live, and it shall praise thee, and thy (That is, thy provident care over me, and wherewith thou wilt judge mine enemies.) judgments shall help me.
I have (Being chased to and fro by mine enemies, and having no place to rest in.) gone astray like a lost sheep: seek thy servant, for I do not forget thy commandments.
